titleStmt.title: John J. Crittenden to James F. Robinson
CWG7827

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Washington D. C.
December 13th 1862.
Dear Sir,

Mr W. A. M. Van Bokkelen has sent me an application directed to your Excellency, accompanied by the proper testimonials, for the appointment of Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky to reside at Virginia City, Storey County, Nevada Territory, and he requests me to forward the same to you with my endorsement thereto.

In transmitting herewith these papers to your Excellency I take pleasure to recommend the apointment of Mr Bokkelen to said office, and, should any difficulty be in the way of forwarding his commission by the applicant's failure to remit the fee, I will thank the Hon Secy of State to write to him to that effect, that he may comply with the
usage requisite in the case.

I am, my dear Sir,
Yours' very truly
J. J. Crittenden

To His Excellency
J. F. Robinson
Governor of Kentucky.

Nevada Ter.
Commr of Deeds
Virginia City
Wm A. M. Van Bokkelen
Appd Decr 18. 1862
